Package com.sun.faces.annotation

Provides annotations necessary to generate run-time and design-time source to support JSF component development.

See: Description

  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Component.ResizeConstraints
    Constraints that determine how a component may be resized in the IDE.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Attribute
    Annotation that groups together information about the JSP attribute for a component property.
    Component
    Annotation that identifies a class as being a JSF component class.
    Event
    Annotation that identifies a component event.
    Localizable
    A marker annotation, used to indicated to annotation processors that the annotated element value may be localized.
    Property
    Annotation that identifies a field or method as belonging to a JSF component property.
    Property.Method
    Annotation that provides additional information about properties of type javax.el.MethodExpression, which are used to invoke a method at run-time.
    PropertyCategory
    Annotation that identifies a public field as being a property category instance.
    Renderer
    Annotation that identifies a class as being a JSF renderer.
    Renderer.Renders
    Annotation that identifies a single component-renderer combination.
    Resolver
    Annotation that identifies a class as being a JSF property resolver or variable resolver, or a JavaEE EL resolver.
    Tag
    Annotation that identifies a class as being the JSP tag class for a component.

Package com.sun.faces.annotation Description

Provides annotations necessary to generate run-time and design-time source to support JSF component development. There are annotations for identifying JSF renderers, JSF components, and component properties. A property may be annotated in any class or interface, not just in a component class.

An simple annotated component class might look something like this:

   @Component(
       name="myComponent",
       family="org.example.mycomponent",
       displayName="My Component",
       tagName="my-component"
   )
   public class MyComponent extends UIComponent {

       @Property (
           name="myProperty",
           displayName="My Property",
           attribute=@Attribute(name="my-property",isRequired=false)
       )
       private String myProperty;

       public String getMyProperty() {
           return this.myProperty;
       }

       public void setMyProperty(String myProperty) {
           this.myProperty = mhyProperty;
       }
   
   }
